comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Douglas AD-4 Skyraider 123898 Repainted in post 1955 Light Gull Gray and Insignia White scheme. Large national insignia with word MARINES and VMA-212 after plus black side code 6 on engine cowling. Curved brown streaked area on fuselage from effect of engine exhaust fumes. Black tail code LD of US Marine attack squadron VMA-212 'Devil Cats' / 'Lancers'. VMF-212 / VMA-212 'Devil Cats' info: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VMFA-212 reocities.com/CapeCanaveral/lab/5428/thehook.html On 10 June 1952 the then VMF-212 was redesignated VMA-212 while serving in the Korean War, and following year transitioned to Douglas AD-2 & AD-3 Skyraiders. VMA-212 remained in South Korea, until April 1955 when they flew their AD-4 types to MCAS Kaneohe Bay Hawaii, to join Marine Aircraft Group-13. In March 1958 VMA-212 traded their AD-6 Skyraiders for North American FJ-4B Fury's. Last five of six digit Navy serial on base of tail. AD-4 Skyraider Bu No 123898 Unfortunately there is as yet no known internet sourced info on the history or eventual fate of Douglas AD-4 Skyraider Bu No 123898. It may have been stored at Naval Air Facility/Station Litchfield Park Arizona then scrapped.
